intro: Psychotria angustiflora, commonly known as the narrow-leaved Psychotria, is a species of flowering plant in the Rubiaceae family. It is native to the tropical regions of Central and South America, particularly in countries like Brazil and Colombia. The plant is characterized by its small, elliptical leaves and clusters of small, white to pale green flowers. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as rainforests and undergrowth. Psychotria angustiflora is also known for its psychoactive properties due to the presence of alkaloids like dimethyltryptamine (DMT).
